[Alessandro Gerada](https://www.liverpool.ac.uk/people/alessandro-gerada) is a final year doctoral student on the AI for Future Digital Health doctoral network, working in the [Antimicrobial Pharmacodynamics and Therapeutics](liverpool.ac.uk/apt) group. He is also a consultant microbiologist at NHS University Hospitals of Liverpool Group, where he leads the [Brucella Reference Unit](https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/brucella-reference-unit-bru). His research work is on artificial intelligence, machine learning, and simulation approaches for challenges in infectious diseases and microbiology, with a focus on antimicrobial resistance.

Here, you will my (opinionated) views on various topics in microbiology.
